content.question: Which of the following identifies the air pollutants most commonly released during the burning of biomass?

choices.label: Lead ( <math alttext="P b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ), carbon monoxide ( <math alttext="C O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ), and nitric acid ( <math alttext="H N O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HN</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> )

Particulate matter ( <math alttext="P M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ), ozone ( <math alttext="O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ), and carbon monoxide ( <math alttext="C O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> )

Carbon dioxide ( <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ), particulate matter ( <math alttext="P M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ), and carbon monoxide ( <math alttext="C O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> )

Polychlorinated biphenyls ( <math alttext="P C B s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PCBs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ), carbon dioxide ( <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ), and chlorofluorocarbons ( <math alttext="C F C s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> )

content.answer: Carbon dioxide ( <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ), particulate matter ( <math alttext="P M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ), and carbon monoxide ( <math alttext="C O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> )

skill.text: Skill 7.B: Describe potential responses or approaches to environmental problems.
